items.message:
High river levels overnight and today may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible on 23 October 2025 from 9am. 
Locations most affected will be low lying land and roads near rivers. Property flooding is not expected. 
We are closely monitoring the situation . 
Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water . 
This message will be updated by 5pm on 23 October 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: The tidal Rivers Bure, Ant and Thurne
items.message:
Tide locking where high tides restrict normal drainage of the river out to sea,  over the next three days may lead to flooding. 

Flooding is possible from today, Thursday 23 October, and over the weekend. 

We expect to see high water levels around Potter Heigham, Wroxham boat yards and Ferry Road in Horning.  The Broads and river levels will remain high over the next couple of days due to tide locking from the current spring tides and surge from a low pressure system.

We are liaising with emergency services and local authorities.  

Avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded. 

This message will be updated by 09:00am tomorrow, Friday 24 October 2025. or as the situation changes.

items.description: Cuckmere River
items.message:
High river levels on Thursday may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible on 23 October 2025 . Half a month's rain (40mm) fell in the last 12 hrs. 
Minor flood impacts could be affecting Hammer Lane, Grove Hill, and Mill Lane, Hellingly. From 09:00 23/10/2025 flooding could affect fields, gardens, and Station Road, Church Lane and Church Road, Hellingly. Only a small amount of rain is forecast over the next 4 days. River levels have already peaked at Cowbeech, and should continue to fall. River levels are currently increasing in Hellingly, but should peak and start to fall by 14:00 23/10/2025. In Alfriston only minimal flood impacts are expected and river levels should fall by 22:00 23/10/2025. 
We are closely monitoring the situation . 
Don't put yourself or others at risk . Avoid roads that flood (Mill Ln Church Rd Hellingly, North St Alfriston). 
This message will be updated by 11:00AM on 24 October 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Uck
items.message:
High river levels on Wednesday may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible on 22 October 2025 from 23:00 as intense (but uncertain) rainfall is forecast. 
Up to 30mm of rain could occur, but there is low confidence. If as much rain falls as predicted, minor flooding could affect riverside properties near the White Hart pub Buxted and Hempstead Mill, Uckfield. In Uckfield most risk is near The Roller Mill, Mill Lane, River Way, Bridge Cottage & Bell Walk. From 04:00 23/10/2025 minor flooding could affect properties at Isfield Mill and Isfield Bridge. Slightly higher river levels than 20/10/2025. Rain is forecast to continue until Thursday afternoon. River levels and flood risk should begin to reduce in Buxted by 13:00 23/10/2025. 
We are closely monitoring the situation . 
Consider activating any flood protection products you may have .Install flood protection products in Buxted and Isfield. 
This message will be updated by 2:00PM on 23 October 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: Upper River Stour
items.eaAreaName: Kent, South London and East Sussex

floodArea.riverOrSea: Great Stour, East Stour, Aylesford Stream, Ruckinge Dyke, Whitewater Dyke, Stour

items.message:
Rising river levels today may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible from the afternoon of 23 October 2025 . 
Locations most affected will be low lying land and roads near rivers along the Whitewater Dyke near Stanhope. 
We are closely monitoring the situation . 
Stay away from floodwater - it contains hidden dangers such as open manhole covers, sewage and chemicals . Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. 
This message will be updated by 6:00PM on 23 October 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: Upper Ouse
items.message:
High river levels on Thursday may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible on 23 October 2025 from 01:00 as intense (but uncertain) rainfall is forecast 
Up to 25mm of rain could occur, but there is low confidence in location. If as much rain falls as predicted, minor flooding could affect Bridge Cottage on the B2028 and roads at Fletching Mill Bridge and Sharpsbridge. From 08:00 23/10/2025 minor flooding could affect the Anchor Inn and Barcombe Mills road. Slightly higher river levels than 20/10/2025. Rain is forecast to continue until Thursday afternoon. River levels and flood risk should begin to reduce in Ardingly by 15:00 23/10/2025 and by 22:00 on 23/10/2025 in Barcombe. 
We are closely monitoring the situation and operating structures at Pimms Lock and Barcombe to reduce flood risk. 
Don't put yourself or others at risk . Avoid roads that flood, including Barcombe Mills Road. 
This message will be updated by 1:30PM on 23 October 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: The tidal River Yare from Thorpe St Andrew to Breydon Water
items.message:
Tide locking, where high tides restrict normal drainage of the river out to sea, over the next three days may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible from today, Thursday 23rd October, and over the weekend. 
We expect to see high water levels in Brundall and Reedham riverside areas. The Broads and river levels will remain high over the next couple of days due to tide locking from the current spring tides and surge from a low pressure system. 
We are liaising with emergency services and local authorities . 
Avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded . 
This message will be updated by 9:00AM on 24 October 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: Tidal Thames riverside from Putney Bridge to Teddington Weir
items.eaAreaName: Kent, South London and East Sussex

floodArea.county: Greater London, Hammersmith and Fulham, Hounslow, Richmond upon Thames, Wandsworth

items.message:
High tides this afternoon may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible from 03:15 PM to 05:15 PM on 23/10/2025. 
The forecast high tide at Richmond is 4.65mAOD at 04:15 PM on 23/10/2025.

We believe there is a possibility of flooding for Putney Embankment (SW15), Chiswick Mall and Strand on the Green (W4), Thames Bank at Mortlake (SW14), Ranelagh Drive (TW1), Friars Lane and Water Lane (TW9), Riverside and The Embankment at Twickenham, and the Towpath below Teddington Lock. Flooding of properties is not expected.

Astronomical tide levels are peaking. The river flow at Teddington Weir is 26 cubic metres per second and is rising. We anticipate the flows to continue to rise for the next 24 hours. 
We are closely monitoring the situation . 
Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water . 
This message will be updated by 6:15PM on 23 October 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: Climping Seafront
items.message:
High tides on Thursday may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible for 2 hours either side of Thursday's early morning tide at 01:00 on 23/10/2025. 
The weather increases tide table values by 0.42 m. Total forecast tide is 6.12 metres Chart Datum (3.07 mAOD) at Littlehampton. Strong South Westerly Force 6 wind. 
Waves could cause overtopping of the beach, affecting Climping Street Car Park. A small amount of water may then flow or be directed westwards along Mill Lane towards residential property in Climping Street. Thursday's tide at 13:15 23/10/2025 is forecast to be 10 cm lower (2.97 mAOD).  Similar minor flood impacts could continue until Saturday, but in general should reduce over the week ahead. 
We are closely monitoring the situation . We routinely check the condition of the beach at Climping 
Consider activating any flood protection products you may have . Access could be restricted. Take care if visiting Climping beach. 
This message will be updated by 6:00PM on 23 October 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: Coast from Heacham to north of King's Lynn in Norfolk
items.message:
High tides and forecast weather conditions tomorrow morning may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible from 6:15am to 10:15am on 23.10.2025 
Areas most at risk are Heacham, Snettisham, Ingoldisthorpe, Dersingham and Wolferton. The detailed forecast is for a peak level at  King's Lynn of 4.51mAODN at 8:15am on Thursday 23, which is 0.91m above tide tables, wind Force 8, Northerly. The high tide tomorrow afternoon is expected to be as high. 
We are liaising with emergency services and local authorities . 
Avoid beaches and coastal promenades, which may be flooded . 
This message will be updated by 12:00PM on 23 October 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: Hunstanton coast in Norfolk
items.message:
High tides and forecast weather conditions tomorrow morning may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible from 6:15am to 10:15am on 23.10.2025 
Areas most at risk are around Hunstanton seafront.  Flood gates in the area will be closed by the Local Authority which will make access difficult. The detailed forecast is for a peak level at  King's Lynn of 4.51mAODN at 8:15am on Thursday 23, which is 0.91m above tide tables, wind Force 8, Northerly. The high tide tomorrow afternoon is expected to be as high. 
We are liaising with emergency services and local authorities . 
Avoid beaches and coastal promenades, which may be flooded . 
This message will be updated by 12:00PM on 23 October 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: Coast from Sandgate to Dungeness
items.eaAreaName: Kent, South London and East Sussex
items.message:
High tides, strong winds and large waves this morning may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible from 10:45am to 2:45pm on 23 October 2025. 
Low lying land near the coast is expected to be most affected, particularly around St Mary's Bay, Dymchurch and Hythe. The detailed forecast is for a peak tide of 4.11m AoD at Rye at 12:45pm BST, with Force 8 north westerly winds and 2.4m waves. This level includes a surge of 0.35m. 
We are closely monitoring the situation and closing flood gates. 
Avoid beaches and coastal promenades, which may be flooded. 
This message will be updated by 9:00PM on 23 October 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: Somerset coast at Porlock Weir
items.message:
High tides, strong winds and large waves tomorrow may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible from 06.15 to 10.15 am for the first high tide and 06.45 to 10.45 pm for the second, on 23/10/2025. 
Flooding is forecast to affect low lying land, roads and paths, particularly around the coastline between Gore Point and Hurlstone Point including Porlock Weir. 
We are closely monitoring the situation and will update messages as the situation changes. 
Avoid coastal roads, footpaths and carparks, which may be flooded around the times of the high tides and take care. 
This message will be updated by 9:30AM on 24 October 2025 or as the situation changes.

High tides and forecast weather conditions tomorrow morning may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible from 05:00hrs to 08:00hrs on 23/10/2025. 
Locations most affected will be coastal roads and footpaths. Our forecasts indicate that flooding to properties is not likely and therefore flood warnings are not expected to be issued. 
We are closely monitoring the situation . 
Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water Avoid low lying coastal roads, as sea spray and waves could be dangerous. 
This message will be updated by 6:00PM on 23 October 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: North Sea coast at Withernsea
items.message:
The Flood Warning has now been removed. However, a Flood Alert remains in force for the wider area, so flooding of roads and low lying land is still possible.  
The previous tide of concern has now passed,  the weather is more settled and no flooding is expected.    
We will continue to monitor the situation and will issue further alerts or warnings if necessary.    
If you have been evacuated only return to your property once the emergency services have advised that it is safe to do so. Never drive through flood water,  just 30cm of fast flowing water is enough to move your car.

items.description: Hollington Stream
items.message:
There is no longer a threat of flooding, though standing water and debris may still remain. 
Weather conditions are expected to improve and no further flooding is expected. Minimal rainfall is expected over the next 5 days and river levels should continue to fall. 
We will continue to monitor the situation and will issue further alerts or warnings if necessary.   
Stay away from floodwater - it contains hidden dangers such as open manhole covers, sewage and chemicals. Never drive through flood water,  just 30cm of fast flowing water is enough to move your car.

items.description: Bridge Road, Emsworth
items.message:
There is no longer a threat of flooding, though standing water and debris may still remain. 
Weather conditions are expected to improve and no further flooding is expected. Last night, just 17mm of rain was recorded at Havant. 
We will continue to monitor the situation and will issue further alerts or warnings if necessary.   
Stay away from floodwater - it contains hidden dangers such as open manhole covers, sewage and chemicals. Never drive through flood water,  just 30cm of fast flowing water is enough to move your car.

items.description: Simeon Street Rec Ground, Ryde
items.message:
There is no longer a threat of flooding, though standing water and debris may still remain. 
Weather conditions are expected to improve and no further flooding is expected. Last night, 29mm of rain was recorded at Ryde.This caused no problems. 
We will continue to monitor the situation and will issue further alerts or warnings if necessary.   
Stay away from floodwater - it contains hidden dangers such as open manhole covers, sewage and chemicals. Never drive through flood water,  just 30cm of fast flowing water is enough to move your car.
